title: A guide to professional doctorates in business & management

description: Are you undertaking (or thinking of doing) a Doctor of Business Administration (DBA) or other professional doctorate (PD) in business and management? Or perhaps you're supervising and delivering one of these programmes? This is your complete - and practical - guide to succeeding on this course. A Guide to Professional Doctorates in Business and Management has been written by a team of experts with experience of the challenges faced in both studying for and supervising professional doctorates in business and management. Inside they address the key issues faced, in particular how these courses differ from a traditional PhD, and the different skills and approach needed for success. Chapters explore the nature and importance of PDs as leading change in the professional world of practice, and ...
contributor: Anderson, Lisa (Lecturer in management education), editor.$$QAnderson, Lisa
contents: A GUIDE TO PROFESSIONAL DOCTORATES IN BUSINESS & MANAGEMENT-FRONT COVER -- A GUIDE TO PROFESSIONAL DOCTORATES IN BUSINESS & MANAGEMENT -- COPYRIGHT -- CONTENTS -- NOTES ON THE EDITORS AND CONTRIBUTORS -- PREFACE -- ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS -- CHAPTER 1- THE DBA AND THE MOVE TO PROFESSIONAL DOCTORATES IN BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT -- SECTION A- DESIGNING AND CONSTRUCTING DBA RESEARCH -- CHAPTER 2- CRAFTING DBA RESEARCH -- CHAPTER 3- CONCEPTS AND THEORY BUILDING -- CHAPTER 4- ACTION MODES OF RESEARCH -- CHAPTER 5- ENACTING THE ACTION MODES OF RESEARCH -- SECTION B- DEVELOPING AS A DBA SCHOLAR AND RESEARCHER -- CHAPTER 6- BECOMING A SCHOLAR-PRACTITIONER -- CHAPTER 7- RESEARCHING AND WORKING IN AND WITH ORGANISATIONS -- CHAPTER 8- ETHICS AND SCHOLARLY PRACTICE -- SECTION C- WRITING UP -- CHAPTER 9- THE DISSERTATION: CONTRIBUTING TO PRACTICAL KNOWING -- CHAPTER 10- PUBLISHING FROM YOUR DBA -- SECTION D- SUPERVISION -- CHAPTER 11- THE DBA AND PHD COMPARED -- CHAPTER 12- SUPERVISING -- INDEX.
